sen.j: 和泉式部（いずみしきぶ、生没年不詳）は平安時代中期の歌人。
sen.e: Izumi Shikibu （dates unknown) was a poet of the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: 和泉式部は姓＋名ではないため、 「天璋院」の例に倣った。
sen.e: Izumi Shikibu （dates unknown) was a poet of the mid-Heian period.
Izumi Shikibu （dates unknown) was a poet of the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 天元 (日本)元年頃（978年？）出生とするのが通説。
sen.e: The generally accepted theory puts her birth around 978.
The generally accepted theory puts her birth around 978.
The generally accepted theory puts her birth around 978.

sen.j: 中古三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: She is regarded as one of the Medieval Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.
She is regarded as one of the medieval 36 immortal poets.
She is regarded as one of the Medieval 36 Immortal poets.
sen.cmt: 名称であるから大文字で始まるべき。“medieval 36 immortal poets”=>”medieval 36 Immortal Poets”

sen.j: 越前国守の大江雅致の娘。
sen.e: She was a daughter of the governor of Echizen, OE no Masamune.
She was a daughter of the governor of Echizen, OE no Masamune.
She was a daughter of the governor of Echizen, OE no Masamune.

sen.j: 和泉国守の橘道貞の妻となり、夫の任国と父の官名を合わせて「和泉式部」の女房名をつけられた。
sen.e: She became TACHIBANA no Michisada's wife, and was called "Izumi Shikibu", a combination of the country of her husband's post and the name of her father's office.
She became TACHIBANA no Michisada's wife, and was called "Izumi Shikibu," this being a combination of the country of her husband's post and the name of her father's office.
She became TACHIBANA no Michisada, Izumi-no-kuninokami's wife, and was called 'Izumi Shikibu,' this being a combination of the country of her husband's post and the name of her father's office.
sen.cmt: 原文の｢｣に合わせ"を'に変更しました。Izumi-no-kuninokami

sen.j: 道貞との婚姻は後に破綻したが、彼との間に儲けた娘小式部内侍は母譲りの歌才を示した。
sen.e: Though their marriage later failed, the daughter born between them, KOSHIKIBU no Naishi, inherited her mother's poetic gifts.
Though their marriage later failed, the daughter born between them--KOSHIKIBU no Naishi--inherited her mother's poetic gifts.
Although their marriage later failed, the daughter born between them--KOSHIKIBU no Naishi--inherited her mother's poetic gifts.

sen.j: はじめ御許丸（おもとまる）と呼ばれた太皇太后宮昌子内親王付きの女房だったらしいが、それを否定する論もある。
sen.e: She was said to be one of the ladies-in-waiting in attendance on Empress Shoshi (also read Masako), and to have been called "Omotomaru" at first, but there are also theories that deny this.

She was said to be one of the ladies-in-waiting in attendance on Empress Shoshi (also read Masako) and to have been called "Omotomaru" at first, but there are also theories that contradict this assertion.

She was said to be one of the ladies-in-waiting in attendance on Empress Shoshi (also read as Masako) and to have been called Omotomaru at first, but there are also theories that contradict this assertion.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』のない" "を削除しました。

sen.j: まだ道貞の妻だった頃、冷泉天皇の第三皇子為尊親王（977年－1002年）との熱愛が世に喧伝され、身分違いの恋だったとて親から勘当を受けた。
sen.e: While she was still Michisada's wife, her love affair with the third son of Emperor Reizei, Prince Tametaka (977-1002) became the gossip of the court, and she was disowned by her father for loving above her station.

While she was still Michisada's wife, her love affair with the third son of Emperor Reizei, Prince Tametaka (977-1002), became the gossip of the court, and she was disowned by her father for loving above her station.

While she was still Michisada's wife, her love affair with the third son of Emperor Reizei, Prince Tametaka (977 - 1002), became the gossip of the court, and she was disowned by her father for loving someone above her station.
sen.cmt: 年号の前後にスペース挿入しました。

sen.j: 為尊親王の死後、今度はその同母弟敦道親王（981年－1007年）の求愛を受けた。
sen.e: After the death of Price Tametaka, she was then courted by Prince Atsumichi (981-1007), his younger brother by the same mother.
After the death of Price Tametaka, she was then courted by Prince Atsumichi (981-1007), his younger brother by the same mother.
After the death of Price Tametaka, she was then courted by Prince Atsumichi (981 - 1007), his younger brother by the same mother.
sen.cmt: 年号の前後にスペース挿入しました。

sen.j: 親王は式部を邸に迎えようとし、正妃が家出する因を作った。
sen.e: When he tried to install her to his mansion, it led to his principal wife leaving him.
When he tried to place her in his mansion, his principal wife left him as a result.
When he tried to place her in his mansion, his principal wife left him as a result.

sen.j: 親王の召人として一子永覚を儲けるが、親王は寛弘4年（1007年）に早世した。
sen.e: As the prince's concubine, she bore him one son, Eikaku, but he died young in 1007.
As the prince's concubine, she bore him one son, Eikaku, but he died young in 1007.
As the prince's concubine, she bore him one son, Eikaku, but he died young in 1007.

sen.j: 寛弘末年（1008年－1011年）、一条天皇の中宮藤原彰子に女房として出仕。
sen.e: From 1008 to 1011, she served as a lady-in-waiting to Empress Shoshi (also read Akiko), the wife of Emperor Ichijo.
From 1008 to 1011, she served as a lady-in-waiting to Empress Shoshi (also read Akiko), the wife of Emperor Ichijo.
From 1008 to 1011, she served as a lady-in-waiting to Empress Shoshi (also read Akiko), the wife of Emperor Ichijo.

sen.j: 40歳を過ぎた頃、主君彰子の父藤原道長の家司で武勇をもって知られた藤原保昌と再婚し、夫の任国丹後国に下った。
sen.e: At past 40, she married FUJIWARA no Yasumasa, a retainer who was famous for his bravery, and went to Tango, the country of her new husband's post.
When she was past age 40 she married FUJIWARA no Yasumasa, a retainer who was famous for his bravery, and went to Tango, the country of her new husband's post.

When she was past the age of 40 she married FUJIWARA no Yasumasa, a retainer of her master Shoshi's father, Fujiwara no Michinaga; FUJIWARA, who was famous for his bravery, went to Tango, the country of her new husband's post.
sen.cmt: × cmt: 文法間違い。 “past age 40 ” => “past the age of 40 ”

sen.j: 万寿2年（1025年）、娘の小式部内侍が死去した折にはまだ生存していたが、晩年の詳細は分らない。
sen.e: She was still alive when her daughter KOSHIKIBU no Naishi died in 1025, but nothing is known about her later years.
She was still alive when her daughter KOSHIKIBU no Naishi died in 1025, but nothing is known about her later years.
She was still alive when her daughter KOSHIKIBU no Naishi died in 1025, but nothing is known about her later years.

sen.j: 恋愛遍歴が多く、道長から「浮かれ女」と評された。
sen.e: Her love affairs were so numerous that Michinaga called her 'a fickle woman'.
Her love affairs were so numerous that Michinaga called her 'a fickle woman.'
Her love affairs were so numerous that Michinaga called her 'a fickle woman.'

sen.j: 真情に溢れる作風は恋歌・哀傷歌・釈教歌にもっともよく表され、殊に恋歌に情熱的な秀歌が多い。
sen.e: Her love poems, laments and Buddhist poems best express her sincere feeling, and she has many masterpieces among her passionate love poems in particular.
Her love poems, laments and Buddhist poems best express her sincere feeling, and she has many masterpieces, particularly among her passionate love poems.
Her love poems, laments and Buddhist poems best express her sincere feeling, and she has many masterpieces, particularly among her passionate love poems.

sen.j: その才能は同時代の大歌人藤原公任にも賞賛され、正に男女を問わず一、二を争う王朝歌人といえよう。
sen.e: Her talent was praised even by her contemporary, the great poet FUJIWARA no Kinto, and she was truly one of the best court poets of either gender.
Her talent was praised even by her contemporary, the great poet FUJIWARA no Kinto, and she was truly one of the best court poets of either gender.
Her talent was praised even by her contemporary, the great poet FUJIWARA no Kinto, and she was truly one of the best court poets of either gender.

sen.j: 敦道親王との恋の顛末を記した物語風の日記『和泉式部日記』があるが、これは彼女本人の作であるかどうかが疑わしい。
sen.e: There exists an "Izumi Shikibu Nikki", a diary of hers in story form, but whether she herself wrote it is questionable.
There exists an "Izumi Shikibu Nikki," a diary of hers in story form, but whether she actually wrote it is questionable.
There exists an "Izumi Shikibu Nikki," a diary about the details of her love with Prince Atsumichi in story form, but whether she in fact wrote it is questionable.
sen.cmt: about the details of her love with Prince Atsumichi の訳を補足しました。"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: ほかに家集『和泉式部正集』『和泉式部続集』や、秀歌を選りすぐった『宸翰本和泉式部集』が伝存する。
sen.e: There are also surviving private poetry collections- "The Main Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu", "The Continued Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu", and "The Shinkan-bon Izumi Shikibu Poetry Collection."

There are also surviving private poetry collections: "The Main Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu," "The Continued Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu" and "The Shinkan-bon Izumi Shikibu Poetry Collection."

There are also surviving private poetry collections: "The Main Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu," "The Continued Poetry Collection of Izumi Shikibu" and "The Shinkan-bon Izumi Shikibu Poetry Collection."

sen.j: 『拾遺和歌集』以下、勅撰集に二百四十六首の和歌を採られ、死後初の勅撰集『後拾遺和歌集』では最多入集歌人の名誉を得た。
sen.e: Starting from the "Shui Wakashu", 246 of her poems were collected in the imperial anthologies, and in the "Goshui wakashu", the first imperial anthology after her death, she had the honor of being the poet with the greatest number of poems included.

Starting from the "Shui Wakashu," 246 of her poems were collected in the imperial anthologies, and in the "Goshui Wakashu," the first imperial anthology after her death, she had the honor of being the poet with the greatest number of poems included.

Starting from the "Shui Wakashu," 246 of her poems were collected in the imperial anthologies, and in the "Goshui Wakashu," the first imperial anthology after her death, she had the honor of being the poet with the greatest number of poems included.

sen.j: 和泉式部の墓所と伝わるものは全国各地に存在するが、いずれも伝承の域を出ない。
sen.e: There are many places said to be the grave of Izumi Shikibu all over Japan, but none of them are more than legendary.
Many places throughout Japan are said to hold the grave of Izumi Shikibu, but none of them is more than legendary.
Many places throughout Japan are said to hold the grave of Izumi Shikibu, but none of them is more than legendary.

sen.j: 柳田國男は、このような伝承が各地に存在する理由を「これは式部の伝説を語り物にして歩く京都誓願寺に所属する女性たちが、中世に諸国をくまなくめぐったからである」と述べている。
sen.e: Kunio YANAGIDA mentioned that the reason why such traditions exist everywhere is 'Because the women belonging to the Seigan-ji Temple in Kyoto who told tales of Shikibu as a katari (oral performance) made their way to every corner of the country during the medieval period.'

Kunio YANAGIDA mentioned that the reason such traditions exist everywhere is 'because the women belonging to the Seigan-ji Temple in Kyoto, who told tales of Shikibu as a katari (oral performance), made their way to every corner of the country during the medieval period.'

Kunio YANAGIDA mentioned that the reason such traditions exist everywhere is 'because the women belonging to the Seigan-ji Temple in Kyoto, who told tales of Shikibu as a katari (oral performance), traveled to every corner of the country during the medieval period.'

sen.j: 現在、岐阜県可児郡御嵩町には和泉式部の廟所と言われる石碑が存在する。
sen.e: There is currently a stone monument said to be her burial place in Mitake Town, Kani District, Gifu Prefecture.
There is currently a stone monument said to be her burial place in Mitake Town, Kani District, Gifu Prefecture.
There is currently a stone monument said to be her burial place in Mitake Town, Kani District, Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 同地に伝わる伝承によると、晩年彼女は東海道を下る旅に出て、ここで病を得て歿したとされている。
sen.e: According to the tradition there, in her later years she made a journey going down the Tokaido and fell ill and passed away there.
According to the tradition there, in her later years she attempted a journey down the Tokaido but fell ill and passed away there.
According to the tradition there, in her later years she attempted a journey down the Tokaido but fell ill and passed away there.

sen.j: 碑には「一人さへ渡れば沈む浮橋にあとなる人はしばしとどまれ」という一首が刻まれている。
sen.e: The poem carved on the monument says ' When one passes by and the bridge sinks, let the one behind stop a while.'
The poem carved on the monument says ' When one passes by and the bridge sinks, let the one behind stop a while.'
The poem carved on the monument says ' When one passes by and the bridge sinks, let the one behind stop a while.'

sen.j: 福島県石川郡 (福島県)石川町には、この地方を治めた豪族、安田兵衛国康の一子『玉世姫（たまよひめ）』が和泉式部であると言い伝えが残る。
sen.e: In Ishikawa Town, Ishikawa District, Fukushima Prefecture, there still remains a tradition that "Tamayohime", the daughter of Kuniyasu YASUDA Hyoe, a local governor ruling that place, was actually Izumi Shikibu.
sen.cmt: 安田兵衛国康 やすだひょうえくにやすではと思われるが、読み方不明
sen.e: In Ishikawa Town, in the Ishikawa district of Fukushima Prefecture, there remains a tradition that "Tamayohime," the daughter of Kuniyasu YASUDA Hyoe, a local governor who ruled that place, was actually Izumi Shikibu.

In Ishikawa Town, in the Ishikawa district of Fukushima Prefecture, there remains a tradition that "Tamayohime," the daughter of Kuniyasu YASUDA Hyoe, a local governor who ruled that place, was in fact Izumi Shikibu.
sen.cmt: punctuation"actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 式部が産湯を浴びた湧水を小和清水（こわしみず）、十三でこの地を離れた式部との別れを悲しんだ飼猫『そめ』が啼きながら浸かり病を治したといわれる霊泉が猫啼温泉として現存する。
sen.e: There still exists the spring called Kowashimizu that was used for newborn Shikibu's first bath, as well as a miraculous spring called Nekonaki Hot Spring where Shikibu's cat "Some", grieving at parting from her, was cured as she cried and her body soaked.

There still exists the spring called Kowashimizu, which was used for the newborn Shikibu's first bath, as well as a miraculous spring called Nekonaki Hot Spring where Shikibu's cat "Some," grieving at parting from her when she was thirteen, was cured as she cried and her body soaked.

A spring called Kowashimizu, which was used for the newborn Shikibu's first bath, still exists, as well as a miraculous spring called Nekonaki Hot Spring where Shikibu's cat "Some," grieving at parting from her when she was thirteen, was cured as she cried and her body soaked.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。不自然。”There still exists the spring called Kowashimizu, which was used for the newborn Shikibu's first bath”=> “A spring called Kowashimizu, which was used for the newborn Shikibu's first bath, still exists,”

sen.j: 佐賀県嬉野市にも和泉式部に関する伝説がある。
sen.e: There also remains a tradition about Izumi Shikibu in Ureshino City, Saga Prefecture.
There also remains a tradition about Izumi Shikibu in Ureshino City, Saga Prefecture.
There also remains a tradition about Izumi Shikibu in Ureshino City, Saga Prefecture.

sen.j: 兵庫県伊丹市に伝わる、大阪府堺市西区 (堺市)平岡町には、居宅跡である「和泉式部宮」がある。
sen.e: According to a tradition in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, the location of her residence is at the 'Izumi Shikibu Temple' in Hiraokacho, Nishi Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 和泉式部宮 定訳不明。実際には「兵庫県伊丹市に伝わる、」の後に文章が続き、「大阪府。。。」は新しい文章になるかと思いますが、オリジナルの txt ファイルのとおりに訳出しております。ご確認ください。
sen.e: According to a tradition in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, the location of her residence is at the 'Izumi Shikibu Temple' in Hiraokacho, Nishi Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
According to a tradition in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, the location of her residence is at the 'Izumi Shikibu Temple' in Hiraokacho, Nishi Ward, Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
